transcript:
- How long do we have to stay in the basement, Ralph? Until this Y2K thing blows over!
- Trust me, it's pandemonium out there. We might even be the last people on earth!
- Fortunately, I've stockpiled enough supplies to last us for a year!
- Dad, Norman ate all the 'Cheetos'! YOU ATE A YEAR'S SUPPLY OF 'CHEETOS' IN HALF AN HOUR? I had the munchies!

- The year 2000! I can't believe it!
- All my life, I've dreamed about what things would be like in the 21st century, and now I know! Dad...
- I MADE IT! RALPH DRABBLE HAS LIVED TO SEE THE NEW MILLENIUM!! Dad...
- Forgive me foe getting so emotional, boys, but this is the greatest experience of my life! Dad.
- What? My teacher says that the new millennium and the 21st century don't officially start until 2001!
-
- YOU MEAN I GOTTA STAY ALIVE FOR ANOTHER WHOLE YEAR??? Sorry. Better cut back on the donuts!

- In preparation for the Y2K disaster, I stored enough food down here to last an average family for one year.
- Unfortunately, Norman has already eaten all the 'Cheetos'...
- And I'm ashamed to admit that I just polished off the beef jerky and 'Pop Tards'!
- Ralph, what are you saying? For lunch tomorrow, we're going to have to eat the cat!

- As you know, the Y2K bug has thrown the world into chaos.
- Since I had the foresight to lead you all to the basement, we are probably the last people alive.
- Therefore, I think our first order of business is to appoint a supreme leader of planet earth. I believe the choice is clear...
- Congratulations, mom! I was talking about ME!!

- Dad, why do we have to stay down here? Trust me, it's bedlam out there!
- Madison Avenue has worked people into a frenzy over this Y2K thing. I think there's a lot of money to be made in frightening weak-minded people!
- So we'll stay her in the storm cellar until things blow over. I didn't even know we had a storm cellar!

-
- Hey, the world didn't come to an end! in fact, everything looks pretty normal!
